bibl.title: About the Right of Passage in Ancient Egypt (Way-in and Way-out of an Estate: eisodos kai exodos).
bibl.note: Reviewing a wide range of occurrences (also Demotic and Hieratic) referring to the right of passage (eisodos kai exodos), observes a continuity which may be traced from Greco-Roman times backwards to the Pharaonic period.

bibl.title: Fundamina. A Journal of Legal History [Pretoria]
Libellus ad Thomasium: Essays in Roman Law, Roman-Dutch Law and Legal History in Honour of Philip J. Thomas

bibl.seg: Schafik Allam, About the Right of Passage in Ancient Egypt (Way-in and Way-out of an Estate: eisodos kai exodos).

R. van den Bergh and G. & Niekerk (edd.), Libellus ad Thomasium: Essays in Roman Law, Roman-Dutch Law and Legal History in Honour of Philip J. Thomas = Fundamina. A Journal of Legal History [Pretoria] 16 (2010) pp. 1-4.

Reviewing a wide range of occurrences (also Demotic and Hieratic) referring to the right of passage (eisodos kai exodos), observes a continuity which may be traced from Greco-Roman times backwards to the Pharaonic period.
